Ok to answer my own question and a few similar ones this game more than likely needs to be ran in compatibility mode.  To do this find the .exe file in the program files in the Deus Ex system folder and go through the properties.  I ran mine in compatibility mode for windows 95 and it now works perfectly.  This is a great torrent and after installing has worked almost flawlessly way better than the GOTY torrent.

FOR ANYONE HAVING CRAZY SPEEDS!

Its a problem with ANY dual(+)core system. Be sure to update(patch) your OS. Be sure to update dErectX =). Be sure to install the processor driver(!).

This is NOT the timings problem of this game, many games like CS get messed up aswell.

This is a .iso file.  Your best bet is to download daemon tools lite (just google it, its free), and install that program on your comp.   Then open daemon tools, and select 
'virtual CDROM' / 'mount image', and select the Deus Ex .iso file you've just downloaded from bittorrent.  
Then autorun will start just as if you had inserted the CD. 
Daemon tools will work for all iso image files, its a very useful program

Hi CallumMcLean,

To solve your opengldrv.dll probleme do the following:
- Download the http://www.down-dll.com/index.php?file-download=opengldrv.dll
- Decompress the file in c:\windows\system32
- Click on "Start > Run" and type "regsvr32 /s opengldrv.dll"

@subtracting and jonesbear aka HOW TO MANUALLY DO CRACK

1.locate deusex.ini
2.Scroll down to [Engine.Engine]
3.In that section find (without quotes) CdPath=x.\
4.Delete the variable and replace with .
5.Save
There you go!
(If putting a period doesnt work just delete the line)
